intro: Sideritis lotsyi var. mascaensis, commonly known as the Masca Sideritis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sardinia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky and dry environments, often found in the mountainous regions of Sardinia. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
